alert.note: Alert for Monterey; San Benito (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 8:48AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .A low pressure system sitting just off the coastline is bringing strong southerly winds and moderate rainfall to the Northern Salians Valley. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Monterey and San Benito. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 848 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.05 and 0.15 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salinas, Hollister, Soledad, Gonzales, Carmel Valley Village, Chualar, Spreckels, Boronda, Prunedale, Ridgemark, San Clemente Dam, San Juan Bautista and Aromas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
